channel.title: Need some advice
channel.description: Long story short I had a bit of a problem and needed to reset my bios, and while I was opening the case I noticed the little plastic cover for the sata cable was missing, I straightened the pins and placed the clip back on and it seems fine now, but will this cause any problems later on?

item.title: Need some advice
item.dc:creator: @inertia inertia
item.description:
@inertia wrote:

[quote=“Elijah, post:11, topic:291569”][quote author=Moparisthebest link=topic=385292.msg2893002#msg2893002 date=1249015231]

go to Radioshack.

Haha, since when? I went into a radioshack about a month ago and asked for a SATA cable, the guy had no idea what I was talking about, and when I explained what it was he said they don’t sell computer parts anymore. An example of a previously nice store, turning into a horrible store.

As long as nothing conductive brushes up against it you shouldn’t have any problems niall.
[/quote]

It’s sad, I went into Radioshack a couple days ago for the first time in two years. And there was an inexperienced woman who was working the front, and she was just blabbing on her cell phone the whole time. Not to mention all that they stock their shelves with anymore is garbage. Their parts drawers are missing some of the most important stuff.

You’re actually able to get more Computer parts at Walmart than Radioshack.[/quote]
At least you don’t live in the UK where the only places to get computer parts are the internet and nigger stalls.

Read full topic

item.title: Need some advice
item.dc:creator: @ThAt0n36Uy Elijah
item.description:
@ThAt0n36Uy wrote:

[quote=“Moparisthebest, post:10, topic:291569”][quote author=the bank link=topic=385292.msg2890046#msg2890046 date=1248839964]
go to Radioshack.
[/quote]

Haha, since when? I went into a radioshack about a month ago and asked for a SATA cable, the guy had no idea what I was talking about, and when I explained what it was he said they don’t sell computer parts anymore. An example of a previously nice store, turning into a horrible store.

As long as nothing conductive brushes up against it you shouldn’t have any problems niall.[/quote]

It’s sad, I went into Radioshack a couple days ago for the first time in two years. And there was an inexperienced woman who was working the front, and she was just blabbing on her cell phone the whole time. Not to mention all that they stock their shelves with anymore is garbage. Their parts drawers are missing some of the most important stuff.

You’re actually able to get more Computer parts at Walmart than Radioshack.

Read full topic

item.title: Need some advice
item.dc:creator: @ThAt0n36Uy Elijah
item.description:
@ThAt0n36Uy wrote:

Could you take a picture of the SATA Ports? If I could see what the port looks like I could probably find you a replacement port.

Read full topic

item.title: Need some advice
item.dc:creator: @The_Un-Named The Un-Named
item.description:
@The_Un-Named wrote:

TabbyKiller:

But i’d say uhm get a Refund or ask them to send you another Coord just to be safe

It’s not the cord, and the mobo is over a year old so no warranty.

item.description:

item.title: Need some advice
item.dc:creator: @Fat_Cookies Fat Cookies
item.description:
@Fat_Cookies wrote:

Niall:

Sorry, perhaps I wasn’t clear. The cable is fine, the plastic bit covering the connections on the motherboard came off, I don’t have anything plugged into it but I was wondering if it’s going to be a problem.

If nothing is connected to it, what can go wrong. iirc SATA is hot-pluggable so it will only try to send data if something is connected.

Read full topic

item.title: Need some advice
item.dc:creator: @The_Un-Named The Un-Named
item.description:
@The_Un-Named wrote:

Sorry, perhaps I wasn’t clear. The cable is fine, the plastic bit covering the connections on the motherboard came off, I don’t have anything plugged into it but I was wondering if it’s going to be a problem.

Read full topic

item.title: Need some advice
item.dc:creator: @the_bank the bank
item.description:
@the_bank wrote:

Get a new cable ASAP. As already said, data corruption will happen. They’re cheap anyways, go to Radioshack.

Read full topic

item.title: Need some advice
item.dc:creator: @ThAt0n36Uy Elijah
item.description:
@ThAt0n36Uy wrote:

I suggest replacing the cable, as Fat Cookies said files could get corrupted if it broke connection. And I’m sure it wouldn’t be to hard since the drive is vibrating, it’ll work itself out.

Read full topic

item.title: Need some advice
item.dc:creator: @Fat_Cookies Fat Cookies
item.description:
@Fat_Cookies wrote:

As long as the contacts on the cable touch the correct contacts on the connector on the motherboard, there’s nothing wrong But I would expect data corruption if they move at all.

Read full topic
